snippet: The trade deficit dropped 4.9 percent in April, to $50.1 billion, because a sharp decline in imports offset the first drop in exports in five months.
abstract: Commerce Department announces that the United States trade deficit narrowed 4.9 percent in April, to $50.1 billion.
lead_paragraph: The trade deficit dropped 4.9 percent in April, to $50.1 billion, because a sharp decline in imports offset the first drop in exports in five months.

headline.main: U.S. Trade Deficit Declines as Imports Fall Sharply
headline.print_headline: U.S. Trade Deficit Declines as Imports Fall Sharply
